title: Consider exporting dynamics data in HDF5 interface

content.raw:
There is a proposal from researchers at RPI to use the [HDF5 data format](http://www.hdfgroup.org/HDF5/Tutor/fileorg.html) in order to [log dynamic simulation states](http://www.cs.rpi.edu/twiki/view/RoboticsWeb/Hdf5). This may be an opportunity to improve the performance of the Gazebo logging system.

HDF5 stands for Hierarchical Data Format (like a binary XML?).

References:

* [Technical paper describing logging format for dynamics](http://www.cs.rpi.edu/twiki/pub/RoboticsWeb/LabPublications/Standard_interface.pdf)
* [Sample hdf5 dynamics logs](http://code.google.com/p/rpi-matlab-simulator/source/browse/solver_work/h5data/)
* [Paper discussing XML vs. binary formats](http://www.hdfgroup.org/projects/nara/XML_and_Binary.pdf)
* [HDF5 command-line tools](http://www.hdfgroup.org/training/HDFtraining/UsersGuide/Utils.fm.html)
content.html:
There is a proposal from researchers at RPI to use the HDF5 data format in order to log dynamic simulation states. This may be an opportunity to improve the performance of the Gazebo logging system.

HDF5 stands for Hierarchical Data Format (like a binary XML?).

References:

  • Technical paper describing logging format for dynamics
  • Sample hdf5 dynamics logs
  • Paper discussing XML vs. binary formats
  • HDF5 command-line tools
